title: ICE when running `x.py check` on rust source

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-custom-config
labels.description: This issue requires custom config/build for rustc in some way

body:
Unfortunately, I'm not sure what an MRE for this would look like, as I was recompiling the standard library. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120 commit-date: 2022-11-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.65.0 LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempted to read from stolen value: rustc_middle::mir::Body', compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/check_unsafety.rs:473:36 stack backtrace: [omitted] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempted to read from stolen value: rustc_middle::mir::Body', compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/check_unsafety.rs:473:36 ```
Backtrace
